Somos una fundación sin fines de lucro,: We are a non-profit organization, founded by parents and professionals, working day after day day to offer a better quality of life to people with neurological and neurodevelopmental difficulties, serving them in the areas of social and academic integration
Ofrecer servicios de salud en evaluación: To offer health services in the forms of evaluation, prevention, diagnostics, and prevention in order to better the social and motor skills of persons who have neurological differences and disorders
En 10 años ser la entidad modelo en cuan: In ten years, we will be the model entity for therapeutic processes and treatment for persons with neurological disorders. Our principles are based in responsibility, in order to treat and assist as many children as possible to provide them with a better quality of life.
Cómo cuidar a un niño con discapacidad?: How to care for a kid with special needs?
La importancia de tener un personal cali: The importance of having qualified staff with a multidisciplinary approach
Qué fabulosa experiencia de vida con ust: What a fabulous life experience with you guys! Thanks to the whole team for these family and warm vibes. Fernanda more particularly welcomed me as a mother and as a super roommate at the same time! The fundation is more and more growing an it was beautiful to be a little part of these progression! Working with children was very enriching and offers the opportunity to learn a lot when you're in this field of study. The setting is very nice to learn Spanish also, although it is totally better to speak enough to have more time with the children in complete independence. In a more general way, the country is beautiful and the Ecuadorians full of kindness! It only takes a few hours of bus to discover it and go from the mountain to the beach. Again thanks for this great adventure, and it's sure than I won't wait too much before to come back to see again the team!
Tuve una experiencia genial trabajando a: I had an amazing experience helping here! I am a senior in college and study psychology and neuroscience. This was a great experience to further my learning of psychology. I think Arupo is doing a great job helping so many children with neurological disorders. Everyone I met in Ecuador was so nice, especially the staff I worked with. I made great relationships and friendships and it also helped me with improving my spanish. I plan on going back soon to visit and show my dad all the great things the project is doing and all that Ibarra has to offer!
Pasé 3 meses en este proyecto lindo en E: I spent 3 months in this beautiful project in Ecuador, and I had a trully beautiful and worth it experience. As a Psychologist I could help out with disable kids and also with their parents, being this an amazing professional experience for me. Also, I spent amazing time with the team, and I lived with two ecuatorian families than made my experience much better.
Pasé dos meses en el proyecto y fue una: I spent about two month in the project and it was an amazing time. I worked as an ocupational therapist with diffrent kids that had developmental disorders. It was great to see how open and thankful everyone was about my work. Although I wasn´t able to speak spanish at the beginning everyone tried to communicate with me and tried to make me feel comfortable at any time. I stayed in a family which was also a unique experience. I came in contact with their culture in a way I wouldn´t be able to do as a normal tourist. During my short time there I got a part of the family, I found new friends and for me it wasn´t the last time to visit that beautiful place. For me it is not the end of a story it is the beginning of a beautiful intercultural friendship. Thanks to everyone who makes it possible.
